name: Visual Studio Extension
summary: A VSIX file is an extension for Microsoft Visual Studio, an Integrated Development Environment ( IDE ) for Windows. It is used to add one or more features to Visual Studio. Each VSIX file is a .ZIP archive that contains a .VSIXMANIFEST file and the extension's resources.

open.note: Open with an associated app listed below.

windows.display_name: Rename .vsix to .zip ; open with any Zip-decompression utility

macos.display_name: Rename .vsix to .zip ; open with any Zip-decompression utility

linux.display_name: Rename .vsix to .zip ; open with any Zip-decompression utility

images.caption: VSIX file open in Microsoft Visual Studio Code
images.alt: VSIX file open in Microsoft Visual Studio Code
